variant.question: The profile drag of a wing section or blade element is proportional to: - The air density - The square of the air density - The square of the relative velocity of the air - The square root of the relative velocity of the air Which of the statements above are correct?

This question does not apply to students of the new 2020 Syllabus
An aircraft flying at 100kts encounters a gust that increases speed by 20kts. What is the resulting load factor?

Which of these statements about the gust load factor on an aeroplane are correct or incorrect? 
I.  When the slope of the lift versus angle of attack curve decreases, the gust load factor increases. 
II. When the wing loading decreases, the gust load factor increases.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is correct.

weight increases.
wing loading increases.
altitude increases.
